    • Method Detail

      • setPreviewUsages

        public void setPreviewUsages(boolean value)
        Description copied from interface: Refactoring
        Controls whether refactoring shows a preview.

        If there are modifications that should be performed in non-java files or not in code, preview will be shown regardless of this setting.

        Specified by:
        setPreviewUsages in interface Refactoring

      • isPreviewUsages

        public boolean isPreviewUsages()
        Description copied from interface: Refactoring
        Returns value of previewUsages property. If there are modifications that should be performed in non-java files or not in code, preview will be shown regardless of this setting.
        Specified by:
        isPreviewUsages in interface Refactoring

      • setInteractive

        public void setInteractive(java.lang.Runnable prepareSuccessfulCallback)
        Description copied from interface: Refactoring
        Controls whether this refactoring is interactive: whether it should show conflicts dialog and other dialogs.

        If prepareSuccessfulCallback is not null, refactoring is interactive, and the callback is executed if user did not cancel the refactoring operation, right after preprocessUsages has finished.

        If prepareSuccessfulCallback is null, user is not presented with conflicts etc., but the preview may still be shown.

        Note: the callback is executed in dispatch thread.

        Refactorings are interactive by default, with empty runnable as a callback.

        Specified by:
        setInteractive in interface Refactoring

      • isInteractive

        public boolean isInteractive()
        Description copied from interface: Refactoring
        Returns whether refactoring is interactive.
        Specified by:

      • findUsages

        public UsageInfo[] findUsages()
        Description copied from interface: Refactoring
        Searches for places in code that refactoring will change. <[> This method should be best invoked in the process with progress and it does all the lengthy code analysis operations.
        Specified by:
        findUsages in interface Refactoring

      • preprocessUsages

        public boolean preprocessUsages(Ref<UsageInfo[]> usages)
        Description copied from interface: Refactoring
        Analyses usages (presumably obtained from Refactoring.findUsages() for possible conflicts and (if refactoring is interactive) presents user with appropriate conflicts dialog.
        Specified by:
        preprocessUsages in interface Refactoring
        See Also:
        Refactoring.setInteractive(Runnable)

      • shouldPreviewUsages

      • doRefactoring

        public void doRefactoring(UsageInfo[] usages)
        Description copied from interface: Refactoring
        Performs all changes in code that are necessary. Does NOT require command or write action, but should be invoked in dispatch thread.
        Specified by:
        doRefactoring in interface Refactoring

      • run

        public void run()
        Description copied from interface: Refactoring
        Runs the whole refactoring. The logic of this method is as follows:
        1. execute Refactoring.findUsages() (with progress dialog and all)
        2. execute Refactoring.preprocessUsages(Ref)
        3. if refactoring was not cancelled, check whether we Refactoring.shouldPreviewUsages(UsageInfo[]), and show the preview
        4. execute Refactoring.doRefactoring(UsageInfo[]) if appropriate (if either the preview was not shown, or 'Do Refactor' button has been pressed)
        Specified by:
        run in interface Refactoring
